Class Odometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • finalProject.Odometer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Odometer
extends java.lang.Thread
    The class responsible for tracking the robot's position and orientation.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mathieu Bolduc

    • Constructor Detail

      • Odometer

        public Odometer(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
        EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
        EV3GyroSensor gyroSensor,
        double track,
        double wheelRadius)
        Constructor for the odometer.
        Parameters:
        leftMotor - The left motor.
        rightMotor - The right motor.
        gyroSensor - The gyro sensor if there is one. If left as null, the angle will be calculated from the motors.
        track - The distance between the two wheels.
        wheelRadius - The radius of the wheels.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • setX

        public void setX(double x)
        Sets the x value of the odometer.
        Parameters:
        x - The new x value.

      • setY

        public void setY(double y)
        Sets the y value of the odometer.
        Parameters:
        y - The new y value.

      • setTheta

        public void setTheta(double theta)
        Sets the theta value of the odometer. If there is a gyro, the robot MUST be stationary, and theta will be set to 0.
        Parameters:
        theta - The new theta value. Must be in rads between 0 and 2pi.

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Returns the current x value of the odometer.
        Returns:
        The current x value of the odometer.

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Returns the current y value of the odometer.
        Returns:
        The current y value of the odometer.

      • getTheta

        public double getTheta()
        Returns the current theta value of the odometer.
        Returns:
        The current angle of the odometer. In rads between 0 and 2pi, starting counterclockwise from the positive x axis.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the odometer's position which fits the EV3's LCD screen.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Thread
        Returns:
        The odometer's x, y and theta, in string form.
